original_definition: 'leaving chilled water temperature' means the temperature of the water leaving the comfort chiller, expressed in degree Celsius.
generated_definition: 'leaving chilled water temperature' means temperature of chilled water after it has been discharged from the cooling system, typically measured in degrees celsius.

Article 1: comfort chillers with leaving chilled water temperatures of less than + 2 °C and high temperature process chillers with leaving chilled water temperatures of less than + 2 °C or more than + 12 °C;
comfort chillers withleaving chilled water temperatures of less than + 2 °C andhigh temperature process chillers with leaving chilled water temperatures of less than + 2 °C or more than + 12 °C;
Article 2: ‘leaving chilled water temperature’ means the temperature of the water leaving the comfort chiller, expressed in degree Celsius.
‘leaving chilled water temperature’ means the temperature of the water leaving thecomfort chiller, expressed in degree Celsius.
whose indoor side heat exchanger (evaporator) extracts heat from a water-based cooling system (heat source), designed to operate at leaving chilled water temperatures greater than or equal to + 2 °C;
